item.title: duplex in C, take two
item.author: me@robxu9.com (Robert Xu)
item.description: I seem to be doing a bunch of rewrites of my older projects nowadays. But sometimes that’s necessary. It is for the case of duplex (and libduplex). Background When I was working at DigitalOcean over the past summer, my main project was a communication framework called duplex. Duplex’s aim was to create a simple messaging framework that could potentially be used for RPC. The first version was prototyped in Go, and I created libdpx, which was the first version in C.

item.title: valgrind is important
item.author: me@robxu9.com (Robert Xu)
item.description: Most people have heard of debugging tools like gdb. For the rest, it’s usually just continuous testing and catching problems with your eye. But sometimes it’s not that simple. Take for example (and I’ve been using this example a lot), libdpx. I was trying to clean up the code for the past two days, but when I moved a simple statement that should work, everything essentially went to hell. You can see that commit here.
